newsitem.title: CHINA: China Xinjiang '96 oil output hits 14.7 mln tonnes.
newsitem.headline: China Xinjiang '96 oil output hits 14.7 mln tonnes.

text.p: China's northwestern region of Xinjiang produced 14.7 million tonnes of crude oil in 1996, up 13.5 percent from the year before, the People's Daily Overseas Edition said on Thursday.
Natural gas output of the region was 900 million cubic metres, the newspaper said. It gave no comparative figure.
Earlier forecasts had put Xinjiang's oil output at 14.15 million tonnes.
Xinjiang still accounts for only a small portion of China's total oil production, which was expected to hit 156.45 million tonnes in 1996.
